Former French president Sarkozy jailed
subhead: Convicted of criminal conspiracy over a scheme to obtain Libyan financing for his 2007 presidential campaign, Nicolas Sarkozy started serving a five-year sentence on Tuesday. He has appealed the verdict and his lawyers have requested an early release.

title: Patrick Artus: 'Accumulated wealth grows faster than real output, disrupting economic balances'
subhead: In his column, the economist outlines the consequences of rising wealth relative to gross domestic product (GDP), both in the United States and in Europe.

title: A new Israeli-Palestinian restaurant promotes peace through food in Paris
subhead: Edgar Laloum and Radjaa Aboudagga have just opened Sababa in Paris, offering bicultural culinary specialties. The two partners hope that, through the joys of culinary arts, they can help foster understanding and calm between communities.

title: How Gustave Courbet's 'Le Désespéré' came to be owned by Qatar
subhead: The emirate purchased the painting for around €50 million about a decade ago from a French family and has agreed to loan it to the Musée d'Orsay for five years.

title: Joyful and massive 'No Kings' protests against Trump reveal a sense of powerlessness
